title: Drawing, "Flowering Branches", 1775–1800
medium: Black, red, blue, and brown chalk on white laid paper
markings: Marked in black ink, lower right branch: N in circle.
provenance: Unidentified collector (Lugt S., l953b); Leon Decloux.
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Drawing of two long branches. Upper left, bouquets of small blue flowers; lower left, small blue flowered bunches with red inverted cone shapes on top; upper right, red rose like flowers sitting on top of feather-like bases.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Flowering Branches", 1775–1800.
1775–1800. Black, red, blue, and brown chalk on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-413.
